Package org.dellroad.stuff.vaadin23.data

Class AsyncDataProvider<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.AbstractDataProvider<T,​SerializablePredicate<T>>
      • com.vaadin.flow.data.provider.ListDataProvider<T>
        • org.dellroad.stuff.vaadin23.data.AsyncDataProvider<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConfigurableFilterDataProvider<T,​SerializablePredicate<T>,​SerializablePredicate<T>>, DataProvider<T,​SerializablePredicate<T>>, InMemoryDataProvider<T>, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    VaadinSessionDataProvider
    public class AsyncDataProvider<T>
extends ListDataProvider<T>
    A ListDataProvider whose contents are gathered in an asynchronous query.

    Instances are just a ListDataProvider with support for asynchronous (re)loading of the underlying data in a background thread using an AsyncTaskManager. As a result, the UI never "locks up" while a backend data query executes.

    The associated AsyncTaskManager provides status change notifications when a load operation starts, completes, fails, or is canceled. These updates can be used to drive GUI loading spinners, etc.

    Load operations are initiated via load(), and may be canceled in progress via cancel(). Initiating a new load operation will cancel and replace any previous load operation still in progress.

    All operations are atomic and race free. See AsyncTaskManager for details.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • AsyncDataProvider

        public AsyncDataProvider()
        Default constructor.

        Caller still must configure an async executor via getAsyncTaskManager().setAsyncExecutor().

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is no VaadinSession associated with the current thread

    • Method Detail

      • getAsyncTaskManager

        public AsyncTaskManager<Stream<? extends T>> getAsyncTaskManager()
        Get the AsyncTaskManager that manages background load operations.
        Returns:
        this instance's AsyncTaskManager, never null

      • load

        public long load​(AsyncDataProvider.Loader<? extends T> loader)
        Trigger a new asynchronous load of this instance.

        If/when the given load task completes successfully, its results will completely replace the contents of this data provider.

        See Loader for important requirements for the behavior of loader.

        Parameters:
        loader - performs the load operation
        Returns:
        unique ID for this load attempt
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the current thread is not associated with this instance's session
        IllegalStateException - if this instance's AsyncTaskManager has no executor configured
        IllegalArgumentException - if loader is null
        See Also:
        AsyncTaskManager.startTask(org.dellroad.stuff.vaadin23.util.AsyncTask<? extends R>)

      • cancel

        public long cancel()
        Cancel any outstanding asynchronous load of this instance.
        Returns:
        the unique ID of the canceled task, if any, or zero if there is no task outstanding
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the current thread is not associated with this instance's session
        See Also:
        AsyncTaskManager.cancelTask()

      • updateFromLoad

        protected void updateFromLoad​(long id,
                              Stream<? extends T> stream)
        Update this data provider's internal list of items using the new data from a successful load operation and fire a refresh notification.

        This is invoked with this instance's session locked.

        Parameters:
        id - task ID
        stream - load results
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the current thread is not associated with this instance's session
        IllegalArgumentException - if stream is null
